BS3: Information on Sexual Reproductive Health and Violence:

ES4: Information on Sexual Reproductive Health:
What language is usually spoken at household ?
Languages will be added as per the country context

Hello! We are working with the Aga Khan Foundation to collect information in different communities to improve development programming. 

Specifically, we would like to understand more about the health status of women, young boys, and girls. 

Further, we would like to ask you some questions about your children who are under 5 in the house, so we can know about their abilities and physical development. 

Thus, we would like to interview the young girls and boys, and mothers of under 5 children in your household. 

In addition, please let us also inform that this interview and survey will not bring any financial benefit for you and your family. 

However, we assure you that names of participants will not be included in any reports and information about a person’s household will also not be shared with anyone else. 

Your participation is voluntary. If for any reason you do not wish to participate, you can choose not to. 

If you do agree to take part now, you can change your mind at any time during the interview, without any implications. 

And in case, if you would like to skip a question, you are also free to do so, and you can object to answering any specific question in the questionnaire which you do not feel comfortable to answer. 

Your identity, personal information, and responses will remain confidential. There are no consequences or disadvantages to deciding not to participate or not to answer certain questions. However, your cooperation is greatly appreciated. 

The interview with all target interviewees in your household should take approximately 120 minutes, but with every individual it should not exceed 30 minutes. 

If you have any doubts or questions about this study, you can contact AKF study team leader and or relevant board in the Ministry of Health at below mentioned phone numbers and email addresses: AKF: XXXXXX IRB MoPH: XXXXXXX
Cell Number of Respondent / Head of Household
First, please tell me the name of each person who usually lives here, starting with the head of the household.
What is the relationship of (name) to (name of the head of household) ?
Record in completed years and months, If age is 95 or above, record ‘95’.
Not Applicable (for Age less 13 years old)
Drop down list to be appear of Married Female
Mother Not Living in the Household
IF Checked dropdown list will disappear
Drop down list to be appear of Married Female
Father Not Living in the Household
Not Applicable (for Age less than 3 or 4 years old)
Not applicable for age less than 10 years

Instructions: Respondent for Module B Sections 1–7: One woman aged 15–49 years with at least one under-5 biological child, where both mother and child are present in the household at the time of the interview - selected using Kish grid.
All MWRA will appear in dropdown list from roster
What was your age at the time of your first marriage ?
How many times you have been pregnant in your life?
How many times have you delivered a live baby in your life?
SUM OF BS1Q8D1+BS1Q8D2+BS1Q8D3 CANT BE GREATER THAN BS1Q7
What was your age at the time of first birth?
How many times you have been Pregnant during last five years?
Please provide the following information for each pregnancy in last five years:
Number of live babies delivered in this Pregnancy
Did you see anyone for antenatal care during your last live birth?
Probe for the type of person seen and record all answers given.
How many weeks or months pregnant were you when you first received antenatal care during last live birth?
Record the answer as stated by respondent. If “9 months” or later, record 9.
IF 98 BS1Q1002 AND BS1Q1002 WILL BE DISABLED
How many times did you receive antenatal care during last pregnancy ?
Probe to identify the number of times antenatal care was received. If a range is given, record the minimum number of times antenatal care received.
Where did your last delivery take place ?
Who checked your health after your last delivery ?

Instructions : Thank you for providing information about your basic information and reproductive history. Now I would like to talk about family planning - the various ways or methods that a couple can use to delay or avoid a pregnancy.Now I would like to talk about family planning - the various ways or methods that a couple can use to delay or avoid a pregnancy.
Have you ever heard of family planning ?
Please name the family planning methods you know.
Vaginal barrier methods (including the diaphragm, cervical cap and spermicidal agents)
Are you or your husband currently using any family planning method?
If yes, which one/s are you using?
Vaginal barrier methods (including the diaphragm, cervical cap and spermicidal agents)
How satisfied are you with the use of modern method of Family planning?
Where did you last obtain the current modern family planning service?
Who primarily decides about use of contraception, regardless of the type?
Can you specify any general perceptions of the community about using any family planning method?
Accepted as a health and economic issue
Taboo, even not to be discussed amongst same gender

Instructions : Thanks a lot for proving me the information about family planning. Now I would like to discuss about Sexual and reproductive health and your opinion about sexual rights and gender based violence. Some of the questions might be disturbing for you and you have the right to not answer them
In your opinion, what can be the consequences of early marriage?
Who makes decisions on Sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) components including:
Do you know about Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)?
Please name Sexually Transmitted Infections that you know.
Please name HIV/ AIDS prevention methods that you know.
Testing and counseling for HIV/aids and Sexually transmitted infections- STIs
Please help in identifying any issues related to sexual and reproductive health prevalent in your community that leads to girls and women facing stigma and discrimination.
Please help in identifying commonly prevalent forms of sexual and gender-based violence in your community.
Denial of access to and control over resources and service
Denial of the right to make decisions
Did you personally face or suffer from any of these?
Denial of the right to make decisions
As a result of violence within your household have you ever suffered from and/or felt like doing the following:
Did you suffer from any physical or mental health problems after you got married because of your intimate relationship with your husband or having a child?
When a woman is physically assaulted or abused by her husband or any other household member, should she seek support/any help outside the family?
From where can a woman seek help when she experiences gender-based violence from her husband or any other household member?
Health Center (for physical and mental damage)
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for seeking education?
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for earning/job?
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for accessing health services?
Thanks a lot for providing me the information about sexual and reproductive health questions. Now I would like to discuss with you about some other health problems.
Have you ever heard of Breast Cancer?
What are the symptoms of Breast Cancer?
New lump in the breast or underarm (armpit)
Thickening or swelling of part of the breast
Irritation or dimpling of breast skin
Redness or flaky skin in the nipple area or the breast
Pulling in of the nipple or pain in the nipple area
Nipple discharge other than breast milk, including blood 6
Any change in the size or the shape of the breast 7
Pain in any area of the breast 8
Have you ever heard about the Self Examination for Breast Cancer ?
Do you know how to do Self Examination for Breast Cancer ?
Have you ever done Breast Self Examination ?
How frequently you do Breast Self Examination ?
Have you ever had your Breasts Examined to detect or check for Breast Cancer ?
Have you ever had mammography to screen for Breast Cancer ?
If yes, when was it done ?
Have you ever heard of Cervical Cancer ?
What are the symptoms of Cervical Cancer ?
What are the risk factors for Cervical Cancer ?
Is there a way to detect cervical cancer before its symptoms develop i.e. in early stages?
Please name any screening tests for cervical cancer that you know of.
How often should the screening for Cervical Cancer be carried out ?
Have you ever been screened for Cervical Cancer ?
How can we prevent Cervical Cancer ?
Avoid long term use of OCPs
Instructions: Now I will ask you some questions about your physical activity and mental health
Do you exercise or play sports daily ?
What exercise/sports do you regularly do (most days of the week) ?
Do you do any other Physical Activities ?
Fetching daily needs of household e.g. water
On an average, what amount of time per day do you spend on exercise, sports and other physical activities?
Do you consume tobacco such as: chewing tobacco, smoking cigarettes, or in any other form ?
Can you name any three symptoms of mental illness ?
Extreme mood changes of highs and lows
Can you name any three mental illnesses ?
Who is the best person to go to in case of a mental health problem ?
Is there any professional help available for mental health problems in your locality / area ?
Have you sought help for mental health in the last years ?
Instructions : Now I will ask you some questions about smartphone and its use.
Do you have access to a smart phone ?
Yes, I have my own phone
Yes, but I use my family member’s phone
Do you have access to internet connectivity on smart phone?
Yes, sometimes I have internet connectivity, but the connection is poor
No, I do not use internet on my phone
Do you have access to a basic feature phone?
Yes, I have my own phone-
Yes, but I use my family member’s phone
If option 2, please mention which family member:
Instructions: Now, I would like to ask you about the engagement of adult/adolscent fathers in your household in caregiving of children under 5:
DROP DOWN LIST OF MARRIED MALE MEMBERS
Is the father adult or adolescent?
Supporting spouse/partner on exclusive breastfeeding and complementary feeding
Playing/ interacting with their young children
Responding timely and appropriately to the cues and signals of their young children
Maintaining daily routines for young children
Ensuring the environment is safe and secure for young children
Supporting spouse/partner in promoting positive discipline at home

Respondent for Module C Sections 1-5: One woman aged 15-49 years with at least one under-5 biological child, where both mother and child are present in the household at the time of the interview - selected using Kish grid at beginning of Module B.
To be asked to mother or caregiver of children 0-59 months old

Thanks so much for providing information about your self and your sexual reproductive health. Now we will move to your children and in this setion we will talk about your child’s development and will ask some questions to you to assess the development of your youngest child.
How many children do you have between the ages of 0-5 years?
In your household, who makes decsions about child’s education (ECD)?
Who makes decisions on child health and schooling except ECD in your household?
Does the father live together with the children?
Where is the father of the children?
Works in another town within country

INSTRUCTION: Use the Kish grid method to select the child regarding whom information would be collected from WRA in remaining questions of Module C. This child must be present in household at the time of interview to be included in Kish grid as there are few observation items in Module C mandating presence of child.
What is the name of this child?
Line number of the selected child
Who takes care of %1$s most of the time when he/she (is) awake?
In your household, who makes decsions about childs education (ECD)?
Who else does %1$s spend most of the time with?
(Record only one. In relation with the child)
Is %1$s enrolled in the Early Childhood Development (ECD) centre ?

Below, I will read you a list of items about availability, and affordability, and access to early childhood services, please tell me how satisfied you’re with each one. This specific satisfaction survey is intended on your experience/s related to early learning/ pre-primary school services. On a scale of 1 to 5, 5 being very satisfied)
How satisfied are you by the distance of ECD center from your home ?
Appropriateness of the activities conducted in the early learning facilities according to the children’s age and mental and physical capacities. Rate each:
Teachers’ skills in facilitating activities with the children
Teachers’ attitude and way of interaction toward children
Teachers’ level of knowledge on the early learning
How satisfied are you with the quality of Learning Materials / Visual Aids / Auditory Aids / Tactile Aids, Toys, and Play Facilities

How satisfied are you with the appropriateness of learning materials/ visual aids/auditory aids/tactile aids,toys, and play facilities according to the age and physical and mental capacities of the children
Implementation of safety and security policies for children in school and immediate vicinity
Level of effectiveness in ensuring school readiness of enrolled children
Level of effectiveness in encouraging parent or primary caregiver involvement and/or family engagement
Health and nutrition measures at ECD centers
Responsiveness of the staff to questions/concerns about the child and the program as a whole
Equal treatment of boys and girls at ECD centers by teachers
Equal treament of chidlren with disabilities, and/or different cultures and socio-economic backgrounds
Participation of parents in preschool/pre-primary activities
Overall service of pre-school or early child center and Overall experience of your child in the ECD center, plus: your overall experience as a parent with a child attending the ECD center

Instructions: I would like to ask you about certain things (name of the child selected above) is currently able to do. Please keep in mind that children can develop and learn at a different pace. For example, some start talking earlier than others, or they might already say some words but not yet form sentences. So, it is fine if your child is not able to do all the things I am going to ask you about. You can let me know if you have any doubts about what answer to give.that children can develop and learn at a different pace.
Can %1$s walk on an uneven surface, for example, a bumpy or steep road, without falling?
Can %1$s jump up with both feet leaving the ground?
Can %1$s correctly use any of the words ‘I,’ ‘you,’ ‘she,’ or ‘he,’ for example, “I want water” or “He eats rice”?
If you show %1$s an object (he/she) knows well, such as a cup or animal, can (he/she) consistently name it?
By consistently we mean that (he/she) uses the same word to refer to the same object, even if the word used is not fully correct.
How many children’s books or picture books do you have for %1$s?
I am interested in learning about the things that %1$s plays with when (he/she) is at home.
Homemade toys, such as dolls, cars, or other toys made at home?
Toys from a shop or manufactured toys?
Household objects, such as bowls or pots, or objects found outside, such as sticks, rocks, animal shells or leaves?
Sometimes adults taking care of children have to leave the house to go shopping, wash clothes, or for other reasons and have to leave young children.
On how many days in the past week was %1$s:
Left alone for more than an hour?
Left in the care of another child, that is, someone less than 10 years old, for more than an hour?
In the past 3 days, did you or any household member age 15 or over engage in any of the following activities with %1$s:
In the past 3 days, did you or any household member age 15 or over engage in any of the following activities with %1$s:
A foster/step mother or father living in the household who engaged with the child should be coded as mother or father.
Ask: Who engaged in this activity with %1$s? (Record all that apply)
Read books or looked at picture books with %1$s?
Sang songs to or with %1$s, including lullabies?
Named, counted, or drew things for or with %1$s?

I would like to ask you some questions about the health and development of %1$s. Children do not all develop and learn at the same rate. For example, some walk earlier than others. These questions are related to several aspects of %1$s’s development.
Can %1$s identify or name at least ten letters of the alphabet?
Can %1$s read at least four simple, popular words?
Does %1$s know the name and recognize the symbol of all numbers from 1 to 10?
Can %1$s pick up a small object with two fingers, like a stick or a rock from the ground?
Is %1$s sometimes too sick to play?
Does %1$s follow simple directions on how to do something correctly?
When given something to do, is %1$s able to do it independently?
Does %1$s get along well with other children?
Does %1$s kick, bite, or hit other children or adults?

Adults use certain ways to teach children the right behavior or to address a behavior problem. I will read various methods that are used. Please tell me if you or any other adult in your household has used this method with %1$s in the past month.
Took away privileges, forbade something %1$s liked or did not allow (him/her) to leave the house
Shouted, yelled at or screamed at %1$s
Spanked, hit or slapped %1$s on the bottom with bare hand
Hit %1$s on the bottom or elsewhere on the body with something like a belt, hairbrush, stick or other hard object
Called %1$s dumb, lazy or another name like that
Hit or slapped %1$s on the face, head or ears
Hit or slapped %1$s on the hand, arm, or leg
Beat %1$s up, that is hit %1$s over and over as hard as one could
Do you believe that in order to bring up, raise, or educate a child properly, the child needs to be physically punished?
Instructions to the parents: I would like to ask you some questions about difficulties %1$s may have.
Does %1$s use any equipment or receive assistance for walking?

In the following questions, I will ask you to answer by selecting one of four possible answers. Remember these four possible answers for each question, you would say that %1$s has: 1) no difficulty, 2) some difficulty, 3) a lot of difficulty, or 4) that %1$s cannot at all.
Instruction for enumerator: Repeat the categories during the individual questions whenever the respondent does not use an answer category.
When wearing (his/her) glasses, does %1$s have difficulty seeing?
Check Child uses a hearing aid?
When using (his/her) hearing aid(s), does %1$s have difficulty hearing sounds like peoples’ voices or music?
Does %1$s have difficulty hearing sounds like peoples’ voices or music?
Check Child uses equipment or receives assistance for walking?
Without (his/her) equipment or assistance, does %1$s have difficulty walking?
With (his/her) equipment or assistance, does %1$s have difficulty walking?
Compared with children of the same age, does %1$s have difficulty walking?
Compared with children of the same age, does %1$s have difficulty picking up small objects with (his/her) hand?
When %1$s speaks, do you have difficulty understanding (him/her)?
Compared with children of the same age, does %1$s have difficulty learning things?
Compared with children of the same age, does %1$s have difficulty playing?
Instructions: This question has five different response options . I am going to read these to you after the question.
Compared with children of the same age, how much does %1$s kick, bite or hit other children or adults?
Module D: Parents Knowledge, Attitudes, and Practices

Respondent for Module D Sections 1-3: One woman aged 15-49 years with at least one under-5 biological child, where both mother and child are present in the household at the time of the interview - selected using Kish grid at beginning of Module B.
Line number of the selected child
Instructions : I would like to know about your child’s gestures and responsivesness towards your caring attitude.
Ask the mother to have the selected child with them. Then observe does she:
Make eye contact with the child
She/he notices the child’s cues and responds properly e.g. hunger, satiety, illness, emotional distress, interest to play, pleasure
Ask: do you know your child’s bedtime, feeding time, playtime?
Instructions: Now, I would like to ask about your practices for the child’s early learning opportunities.
Observe: If the parent does: (1) Rattles/noise shakers (2) simple flash cards or story books can be used by the enemerator during the observation
Mother: Using activities that encourage young children to move their bodies, activate their five senses, hear and use language, and explore
Mother: Talking to and with the baby/toddler/child - Smiling, imitating/copying, and simple games (e.g., peek a boo)
(For observing age-appropriate interaction the observer must know the milestones and their utilization)
Child: Age-appropriate play with household objects, pet and domestic animals, and people
Instructions: Now, I would like to know about your practices for the safeguarding of the child.
Observe: is the child practising/maintaining good hygiene?
Observe: is the parent practising good hygiene?
Ask to observe where the child plays usually.
Are there sharp items in the play environment?
Are there flows, ditches, water streams that can drown sink a child around the play environment?
Is there a risk of the child falling from a height in the play environment?
Is there a risk of wild animals, harmful insects, and exposure to the disease in the play environment?
Is the child being watched over an adult while in the playing environment?
Overall, is the environment considered safe for child play?

Respondents for Module E Sections 1-4: (1) One unmarried adolescent boy 15-19 years old present at the time of interview in the household selected using Kish grid (2) One unmarried adolescent girl 15-19 years old present at the time of interview in the household selected using Kish grid. [If neither an eligible adolescent boy nor an eligible adolescent girl is available, then end interview]. For adolescents less than 18 years of age, an assent will be taken from the respondent and a consent will be taken from the parents or caregiver of the respondent present in the household at the time of the interview.
All Male Female un-married Adolesent will appear in dropdown list from roster
Assent Provided By Respondent (if less than 18 years of age)

Consent Provided By Respondent’s 
Parents ( if age < 18 ) or 
Guardian ( if age < 18 ) or 
Self ( if age > 18 )
What is your highest level of completed education?
Are you currently in school/college/other education or training?
At what age did you finish school/college?
To help with the household chores
Do you expect to return to school/college?
Do you expect to return to other education or training? (If not school/college/formal education)
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for:
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for seeking education?
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for earning/job?
In your opinion: Should men and women have equal right to decide and go out for accessing health services?
Now I would like to ask you some questions about your personal rights.
Has anyone in your family ever given you information on what constitutes a healthy sexual and reproductive life?
Do you think girls and boys should be informed about and be aware of Sexual and Reproductive Health rights?
Do you have to seek your parents’ permission when you go out of the house, for other occasions rather than daily needs and school?
Is there a time for you to be home by the end of each day?
Do you need your parent’s permission to travel alone i.e. visit friends, out of city etc.?
Do your parents call to check on you when you’re outside?
Can you comfortably propose or share your opinion /point of view with your parents?
If no, please state the reason
How often your parents involve you in decisions related to your daily routine/ life?
Who makes decisions related to availing health services (including visiting a health facility and getting help) for you?
Now we will talk about your mental health and if you consider these questions are not appropriate you can chose not to answer them
Do you exercise or play sports daily?
What exercise/sports do you regularly do (most days of the week)?
How do you usually go to school/ work ?
Do you do any other physical activities?
On an average, what amount of time per day do you spend on these activities i.e. Sports, exercise and other physical activities?
Do you consume tobacco? Such as chewing tobacco, smoking cigarettes or in any other form?
Can you name any three symptoms of mental illness?
Extreme mood changes of highs and lows
Can you name any three mental illnesses?
Who is the best person to go to in case of a mental health problem?
Did you mostly feel sad and/or anxious during past months?
Is there any professional help available for mental health problems in your locality/area?
Have you sought help for mental health in the last 3 years?
Now I would like to discuss about your knowledge of different health topics, sexual and reproductive health and rights.
In your opinion, what can be the consequences of early marriage?
Do you know about Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI)?
Please name Sexually Transmitted Infections that you know.
Please name HIV/AIDS prevention methods that you know.
Please help in identifying any issues related to sexual and reproductive health prevalent in your community that leads to girls and women facing stigma and discrimination.
Please help in identifying commonly prevalent forms of sexual and gender-based violence in your community.
Denial of access to & control over resources and service
Denial of the right to make decisions
Are you aware of any contraceptive methods available for family planning ?
Please name the family planning methods you know.
Vaginal barrier methods (including the diaphragm, cervical cap and spermicidal agents)
Section A2: List of Household members:
Section A5: Food Insecurity Experience Scale – FIES (Household Referenced):

Section B2: CCT- Ehsaas Nashonuma Program Information:

SECTION D4: MORBIDITY & CARE SEEKING BEHAVIOUR (CS):
Instructions: For all available women of reproductive age (15–49 years) and Children under 5 years
Module A: Household and Members information
Instruction: To be filled by data collector
Respondent should be 18 years & above.If not, then probe if anyone >18 years is present at home. If not, then end the interview.
Does this Household have a BISP beneficiary?
Does this Household have an under five Child?
Instructions: To be filled by head of household. If not available, then from any available adult (>18 years) available at home
Circle the name of BISP beneficiary mentioned in the provided list Probe for additional household members.
First, please tell me the name of each person who usually lives here, starting with the head of the household.
Month is mandatory for child under 5 years (If month / date don’t know write 98, or if year don’t know write 9998)
How old is (name)? if date of birth is not available
Record in completed days month and years.
Can you please identify whether you have availed any of these programs? *[Multiple response]
What is the mother tongue of the head of the household?
What is ownership status of home you live in?
What is the main source of drinking water in your household?
Tube well or borehole or suction pump
How long does it usually take you to go to your main water source, get water, and come back?
Record the number of minutes if known (record 000 if on premises or delivered to home and 998 if unknown) __________________minute
Do you usually take any step to make the water safer to drink?
What do you usually do to make the water safe to drink?
What type of toilet facilities do you usually use in your household?
Do you share this toilet facility with other households? (With the people who aren’t members of this household)
How many other households use this toilet facility?
What is usually done to dispose the stool of the youngest child?
Put/rinsed on into toiled or latrine
Does your household have? Ask/probe for each
Does any member of this household own: Ask/probe for each
What type of fuel do you usually use for cooking in your household?
Do you have a separate room which is used as a kitchen?
Main material of the dwelling floor:
Main material of the exterior walls
How many rooms in your household are used for sleeping?
Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?
If yes, how many acres or Kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own?
Does any member of the household own livestock, animals, or poultry?
How many livestock, animals or poultry does your household own?
Ask for each listed animal one by one and observation by enumerator. Insert 000 if none
Please show us where you and members of your household most often wash their hands.
Observe presence of water at the place for hand washing.
Observe presence of soap, detergent or other cleansing agent. [Multiple responses]
Do you have any soap or detergent in your household for hand washing?
Can you please show it to me? [Multiple responses]
In what situations do you wash your hands with soap? [Multiple responses]

This is an open-ended question. Do not read the answer choices. After the respondent stops listing times, ask “Are there any other situations where you wash your hands with soap?” Keep asking this question until the respondent thinks there are no other times.
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household were worried you would not have enough food to eat because of lack of money or other resources?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household were unable to eat healthy and nutritious food because of a lack of money or other resources?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household ate only a few kinds of foods because of lack of money or other resources?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household had to skip a meal because there was not enough money or other resources to get food?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household ate less than you thought you should because of lack of money or other resources?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when your household ran out of food because of a lack of money or other resources?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household were hungry but did not eat because there was not enough money or other resources for food?
During the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household went without eating for a whole day because of a lack of money or other resources?
Available eligible respondent not competent for interview
Instructions: Module B is to be filled by any one BISP beneficiary available in the household at the time of interview. If there are more than one beneficiary, select the youngest beneficiary.
I would like to ask you about BISP assistance provided to your household. This excludes support from family, other relatives, friends, or neighbors.
Line number of the index Woman
CNIC number / BISP ID of index woman
Not available at the time of interview
How long have this household been a BISP beneficiary?
When did you last receive the amount?

Who usually uses the received amount? [Multiple responses]

On which item did you spend the highest amount?

How long does it take to reach the payment facility?
How much is usually spent on travelling to the beneficiary center or to the POS agent/shop (two way) to receive the amount?
Do you face any difficulty in reaching the designated point?
Check from the roster if the eligible BISP beneficiary is enrolled in ENP. If yes go to W121. If No, go to W119

Do you know about the Ehsaas Nashonuma program?

Module C: Women of Reproductive Age 15 – 49 Years
Instructions: Respondent of Module C and D will be the mother or caregiver (15–49 years of age) of the youngest under 5 years child available in the household.
Incase of caregiver, skip Module C, and respond to Module D only.
What was your age, at the time of your marriage?
What was your age of menarche?
How many times you have been pregnant in your life? (including current pregnancy)
How many times have you delivered in your life (including stillbirths)?
How many times you have been Pregnant during last five years? (Excluding current Pregnancy)
What was your age at the time of first birth?
What was the date of your last menstrual period?
Did you see anyone for antenatal care for your current pregnancy?
Whom did you see? Probe for the type of person seen and record all answers given. [Multiple responses]
How many weeks or months pregnant were you when you first received antenatal care during current pregnancy? Record the answer as stated by respondent. If “9 months” or later, record 9.
How many antenatal care visits have you done so far?
During your antenatal care visits so far, did any of these happen at least once?
Did you take iron folic acid (IFA) during your current pregnancy?
At what time of pregnancy did you start taking IFA?
Who advised to take any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant? [Multiple responses]
From Where did you get iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant? [Multiple responses]
How many days did you take IFA during current pregnancy?
Did you use multiple micronutrient supplement (MMS) during your current pregnancy?[Show images of MMS]
At what time of pregnancy did you start taking multiple micronutrient supplement (MMS)?
How many days did you use multiple micronutrient supplement (MMS) during current pregnancy ?
From Where did you get multiple micronutrient supplements (MMS) while you are pregnant? [Multiple Responses]
Did you use supplemental nutrition food (SNF) during your current pregnancy ?
How many sachets have you consumed in the past 4 weeks?
Where did you get SNF from?
Did you receive any injection in the arm or shoulder to prevent the baby from getting tetanus, that is, convulsions after birth in your current pregnancy?
How many times did you receive tetanus injection during the pregnancy?
Did you see anyone for antenatal care during your last completed pregnancy with (name)?
Whom did you see? Probe: Anyone else?
Probe for the type of person seen and record all answers given.
Where did you recive antenatal care?
How many weeks or months pregnant were you when you first received antenatal care during last pregnancy? Record the answer as stated by respondent. If “9 months” or later, record 9.

How many times did you receive antenatal care during last pregnancy? Probe to identify the number of times antenatal care was received. If a range is given, record the minimum number of times antenatal care received.
As part of your antenatal care during your pregnancy, were any of the following done at least once? (Ask about each option and circle all positive responses)
Did you take iron folic acid (IFA)/FefolVit during your previous pregnancy?
At what time of pregnancy did you start taking IFA?
Who advised to take any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant?
From Where did you get iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant?
How many days did you take IFA during pregnancy?
Did you use multiple micronutrient supplement (MMS) during your last pregnancy? [Show images of MMS]
At what time of pregnancy did you start taking MMS?
How many days did you use MULTIPLE MICRONUTRIENT SUPPLEMENTS (MMS) during last pregnancy?
From Where did you get multiple micronutrient supplements (MMS) while you were pregnant?
Did you use supplemental nutrition food (SNF) during your last pregnancy?
How many sachets did you consume during your last pregnancy?
Where did you get SNF from?
Did you feel you had night blindness (difficulty in seeing clearly in dusk) during your last pregnancy?
When you were pregnant with, did you receive any injection in the arm or shoulder to prevent the baby from getting tetanus, that is, convulsions after birth?
How many times did you receive tetanus injection during the pregnancy?
Where did you give birth to (name)? Probe to identify the type of place.
What was the type of delivery?
What was the gestational age at the time of delivery? (in months)
How much did (name) weigh? If a card is available, record weight from card.
In your opinion when (name) was born, was s/he very large, larger than average, average, smaller than average or very small?
Within one hour after birth, was (name) put directly on the bare skin of your chest?
Before being placed on the bare skin of your chest, was the baby wrapped up?
When was (name) dried or wiped after birth? (if < 1 hour record “00”)

How long after the birth was (name) bathed for the first time? If “immediately” or less than 1 hour, record ‘000’. If less than 24 hours, record hours. If “24 hours”, probe to ensure best estimate of less than 24 hours or 1 day. If 24 hours or more, record days.
After the cord was cut and until it fell off, was anything applied to the cord?
What was applied to the cord?
If Chlorhexidine was used ask the respondent about the source of provision?
Did anyone check on your health during 6 weeks after delivery?
Who checked your health after delivery?
How long after delivery did the first of these check-ups happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. Otherwise, record weeks.
How many times did such check-ups happen in the first 6 weeks?
What happened during the check-ups? (Read out each option for the respondent and select accordingly)
Did anyone check on (name of child) health?
Who checked the child’s health after delivery?
How long after delivery did the first of these checks happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. Otherwise, record weeks.
How many times such check happen?
What happened during the check up? (Read out each option for the respondent and select accordingly)
Did you receive supplemental nutrition food (SNF) during your PNC period of 6 weeks?
How many sachets did you receive?
How many sachets did you consume?
Where did you get SNF from?
Have you ever used contraception methods to avoid pregnancy?
Are you currently using any contraception method to avoid pregnancy?
If Yes what contraception methods, you are using
Has any LHW (lady health worker) ever visit your household in the past 2 years?
How often does an LHW visit your household?
What was done during the last visit of LHW?
Supplying iron and folic acid supplements
When did LHW last conduct a health and nutrition session?
Have you ever attended one of LHW’s health and nutrition sessions?
How often do you attend these sessions?
Note: Interviewer will show the Food Products during the interview
In past 4 weeks, did anyone in your household receive the following assistance?
RUSF (ready to use supplemental food) for children (Wawamum)
How many sachets have been received in past 4 weeks?
RUTF (ready to use therapeutic food) for children
How many sachets have been received in past 4 weeks?
How many sachets have been received in past 4 weeks?
How many sachets have been received in past 4 weeks?
Where are the received supplements stored?

Instructions: Ask the women about her diet which she has taken yesterday after she wake up till, she went to bed for sleep Refer to the Food Group Booklet to identify and elaborate the food item and record its utilization in the table below.

Grains, White Roots and Tubers, and Plantains (Barley, Millet, Oats, Rice, Sorghum, Wheat, Arracacha, Bananas, Cassava, Lotus Root, Potatoes (all skin colors), Rutabaga, Sweet Potato (White, pale yellow fleshed), arbi/arvi)
Pulses (Beans, Peas, and Lentils) (Adzuki Bean, Broad Bean, Chickpeas, Cluster Bean, Common Bean, Lentil, Mung Bean, Pea, Pigeon Pea, Rice bean, Soybean (Soya Bean), Urad Bean)
Nuts and Seeds (Peanut/Groundnut, Almond, Cashew, Pistachio, Walnut, Wild Mango (Bush Mango), Locust Bean Seeds, Melon Seeds, Pine Nuts, Pumpkin Seeds, Sesame Seeds, Sunflower Seeds)
Dairy (Fresh Whole, Low Fat, Skim milk, reconstituted powdered or evaporated or ultra-high temperature (UHT) boxed milk, Hard cheese, Soft cheese, Kefir, Yoghurt/Curd)

Meat, Poultry, and Fish (Beef, Goat, Mutton, Lamb, Rabbit, Yak, Deer, Antelope, Buffalo or other large wild or domesticated mammals, Tripe or other pale organ meats, Chicken, Duck, Goose, Guinea Fowl, Pigeon, Turkey, Other wild or domesticated birds, Gizzard, Heart, Kidney, Liver, Fresh/Frozen/Dried Fish (all species), Canned Fish (Tuna and Sardines), Shrimp, Lobster, Carbs)
Eggs (Chicken Eggs and Duck Eggs, Egg powder)

Dark Green Leafy Vegetables (Bean Greens, Beet Greens, Bitter Melon Greens, Broccoli, Carrots Green, Chicory Greens, Chilli Greens, Chinese cabbage, Fenugreek Greens (Methi), Lettuce, Mustard Green, Okra Greens (Lady Fingers), Pumpkin Green, Spinach, Turnip Greens)

Other Vitamin A-rich Fruits and Vegetables (Apricot (Fresh or Dried), Cantaloupe Melon (Ripe), Locust Bean Fruit/Pulp, Mango (Ripe, Fresh and Dried), Musk Melon, Papaya (Ripe, fresh and dried), Peaches (dried or raw), Persimmon (ripe), Carrot, Pumpkin, Red Pepper (sweet), Squash (Orange or dark yellow fleshed only), Sweet Potato (Orange or Dark yellow fleshed only))

Other Vegetables (Asparagus, Beans (various) when eaten as fresh pod, Beets, Bitter melon, Cabbage (Common and Red varieties), Cauliflower, Celery, Corn (fresh, not dried /flour/meal - Green Maize), Cucumbers, Eggplant (Brinjal), Green Pepper, Leek, Lettuce (Light Green), Mushroom, Okra, Onion, Pea’s green, Radish, Tomato, Zucchini)

Other Fruits (Apple, Avocado, Banana, Blackberry, Blueberry, Cherries, Coconut Flesh, Dates (Fresh and dried), Grapefruit, Grapes, Guava, Honeydew Melon, Indian Gooseberry (Amla), Jujube, Kiwi, Lemon, Lime, Litchi, Mandarin Orange, Mulberry, Orange, Peach, Pear, Pineapple, Plum, Pomegranate, Pomelo, Rambutan, Raspberry, Sapodella (naseberry), Star Fruit, Strawberry, Sweetsop, Tamarind, Tangerine, Watermelon)
Available eligible respondent not competent for interview
Instructions: Respondent of Module D will be the mother (15-49 years of age) or caregiver of the selected child under-5 years available in the household.
If there are more than one under-5 children available in the household then use Kish grid for selection.
Section D2 ‘IYCF and Food diversity’ will only be filled for children 0-23 months. If the child’s age is 24-59 months, then Section D2 will be skipped.
Relationship of child with the respondent
Was (name’s) birth registered with NADRA and B-form was obtained?
Section D3: IYCF and Food Diversity (FD)
INSTRUCTION: This section is to be asked if the child’s age is 0-23 months, if the child is 24-59 months of age, this section will be skipped.
How long after birth was [NAME] first put to the breast? If immediately, circle “000” If less than one hour, record “00” hours If less than 24 hours, record hours Otherwise, record days

In the first two days after delivery, was [NAME] given anything other than breast milk to eat or drink –[ MASKA/BUTTER IS TRADITIONAL, common drinks and foods, including ritual feeds(Ghutti, Honey), that may be given to newborn infants]?
Was [NAME] breastfed yesterday during the day or at night?
Did [NAME] drink anything from a bottle with a nipple yesterday during the day or at night?

Now I would like to ask you about liquids that [NAME] had yesterday during the day or at night. Please tell me about all drinks, whether [NAME] had them at home, or somewhere else. Yesterday during the day or at night, did [NAME] have?
Infant formula, such as [insert local names of common formula] NAN, NUTRILAK, NESTLE, NESTOGEN, SIMILAK
If “yes”: How many times did [NAME] drink formula? If 7 or more, record “7” If number of times not known, record “99”
Milk from animals, such as fresh, tinned, or powdered milk?
If “yes”: How many times did [NAME] drink milk?If 7 or more, record “7” If number of times not known, record “99”
If “yes”: Was the milk or were any of the milk drinks a sweet or flavored type of milk?
Yogurt drinks such as [insert local names of common types of yogurt drinks
If “yes”: How many times did [NAME] drink yogurt? If 7 or more, record “7” If number of times not known, record “99”
If “yes”: Was the yogurt or were any of the yogurt drinks a sweet or flavored type of yogurt drink?
Chocolate-flavored drinks including those made from syrups or powders?
Fruit juice or fruit-flavored drinks including those made from syrups or powders?
Sodas, malt drinks, sports drinks, or energy drinks?
If “yes”: Was the drink/ Were any of these drinks sweetened?
If “yes”: Was the drink or were any of these drinks sweetened?

Now I would like to ask you about foods that [NAME] had yesterday during the day or at night. I am interested in foods your child ate whether at home or somewhere else. Please think about snacks and small meals as well as main meals. I will ask you about different types of foods, and I would like to know whether your child ate the food even if it was combined with other foods in a mixed dish like [list common local examples of mixed dishes] Please do not answer “yes” for any food or ingredient used in a small amount to add flavor to a dish. Yesterday during the day or at night, did [NAME] eat:
If “yes”: How many times did [NAME] eat yogurt?
Any other meat, such as beef, lamb, goat, chicken, duck
Beans, peas, lentils, nuts, seeds or [insert commonly consumed foods made from beans, peas, lentils, nuts, or seeds]?
Sweet foods such as chocolates, candies, pastries, cakes, biscuits, or frozen treats like ice cream and popsicles
Chips, crisps, puffs, French fries, fried dough, instant noodles
Any other solid, semi-solid or soft food?
If “yes”: What was the food? [mark food group if it is not yet coded “yes”]
How many times did [NAME] eat any solid, semi-solid or soft foods yesterday during the day or night? If 7 or more times, record “7” If number of times not known, record “99”
Have you received extra food (SNF) for your baby (6-23) in the last 4 weeks?
How many sachets/ cartons has the child consumed in past 4 weeks ?
Where did you get SNF (Wawamum) from?
INSTRUCTION: To be asked for the selected under five child.
Did you ever have a vaccination card from a government or private health provider where (name)’s vaccinations are written down?
If yes: may I see it please? The respondent should already have brought the card when you got permission to begin the interview.
If not, why you didn’t receive any vaccination card?
Could not visit a facility because of COVID-19
Card was not available with the health
The vaccinator/ facility didn’t provide the card
Check and copy Date of Birth recorded on card
INSTRUCTION: Please record the date of immunization for each antigen from the card
If the date is recorded but not readable, record 44 in day column
If the date is not recorded but a tick () mark is present, record 88 in day column
If neither date is recorded nor a tick () mark is present, prompt the mother for each such antigen and record 66 if she confirms the receipt of respective antigen by recall otherwise record 97.
Check D305-1 till D305-16: Are all vaccines (BCG to Measles-2) recorded?
Has (name) ever received any vaccinations to prevent (him/her) from getting diseases, including vaccinations received in a campaign, immunization day or Child Health Day?
Has (name) ever received a BCG vaccination against tuberculosis – that is, an injection in the arm or shoulder that usually causes a scar?

Has (name) ever received any vaccination drops in the mouth to protect (him/her) from polio? Probe by indicating that the first drop is usually given at birth and later at the same time as injections to
Were the first polio drops received in the first two weeks after birth?
How many times was the polio vaccine received at Govt/Public health facility or from outreach facility?

Has (name) ever received a pentavalent vaccination – that is, an injection in the thigh to prevent (him/her) from getting tetanus, whooping cough, diphtheria, hepatitis b disease, and haemophilus influenza type b? Probe by indicating that pentavalent vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the polio drops.
How many times was the pentavalent vaccine received?

Has (name) ever received a pneumococcal conjugate vaccination – that is, an injection to prevent (him/her) from getting pneumococcal disease, including ear infections and meningitis caused by pneumococcus? Probe by indicating that pneumococcal conjugate vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the pentavalent vaccination
How many times was the pneumococcal vaccine received?

Has (name) ever received drops for rotavirus vaccine (rv) vaccination- a vaccine given orally soon after 6 weeks birth to protect against rotavirus infections, which are the leading cause of severe diarrhoea among young children?
How many times were the drops received?
Has (name) ever received an inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) – that is, a shot in the thigh at the age of 14 weeks or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting polio?
Has (name) ever received a measles injection – that is, a shot in the arm at the age of 9 months or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting measles?
How many times was a measles injection vaccine received?
Where is (name) usually vaccinated? If the child is vaccinated from multiple sources, mention the usual source with higher frequency of vaccine doses.
What means of transportation do you use for visiting the facility for immunization of (name)?
What is the time taken to reach this facility where vaccination was received?

(Applicable If the child has not received all their vaccinations, ask the mother/caretaker) Why (name) is not vaccinated? Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons. [multiple responses]
Child ill, brought but not vaccinated
Time or place of immunization not known
Took child but no vaccine available
Took child but not vaccination day
COVID-19-related (fear of going out, sickness in family)
Has the child ever received polio drops during a national polo campaign?
How many times has (name) polio drops been given during the national polio campaigns?
Did (name) receive polio drops during the last campaign
The last time (name) received the polio drops, did (he/she) also get an injection to protect against polio? Probe to ensure that both were given, drops and injection
Why did (name) not receive polio drops during the last campaign? Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons. [Multiple check]
Not at home when vaccinator came
Took child but no vaccine available
COVID-19-related (fear of going out, sickness in family)
SECTION D4: MORBIDITY & CARE SEEKING BEHAVIOUR (CS)
INSTRUCTION: To be asked for the selected under five child.
Did the child (NAME) suffer from any of the following illnesses in the past 2 weeks? [Multiple responses]
Did you seek any care for these illnesses during the last 2 weeks?
Who did you see for the illness (s) in the last 2 weeks? Probe: Anyone else? [PROBE TO IDENTIFY EACH TYPE OF PERSON AND RECORD ALL MENTIONED] [Multiple responses]
What was given to treat diarrhea (if applicable)?
No eligible respondent available for this module
Available eligible respondent not competent for interview
